climbs.name: Boca Roca Grande
climbs.fa: Hugh Dougher and Henry McMahon, pre 1978

content.description:
The well protected right-facing corner with two large roofs. Begin on a narrow ledge 15ft above the trail with rhododendron and a maple growing on its left end. 30 feet downhill and left of this is a flat spot in the trail at a boulder with a finger crack (Henry's Hangout 5.11) Dougher and McMahon originally graded this route 5.5. With more traffic, this route would be excellent. Can be done as one pitch.  

  P.1 5.7+ 120ft   Up the corner past two trees to large roof. Finagle past the awkward roof and belay just above it on small to medium sized gear.  

  P.2 5.6 60ft   Move up to the second roof and pass it on the right. Up a short wide crack (only need .75s) to a tree. The tree blocks the way, so we swung left onto the short white slab to the top, with better exposure. Belay at a horizontal with finger sized gear.   

  Descent:   There is no rap station. Walk off up and left and descend down the power lines, or rap off one of the hemlocks 30ft to the left (not recommended).
content.protection: Typical water gap rack. Doubles .5-#2 camalot. Long slings helpful.
content.location: Prominant right-facing corner with two large roofs.

content.description: The left end of the Minsi cliff, 100 feet or so from Billy Goat Gruff Buttress. The main feature of this wall is the large right-facing corner system.
